definitions: wild uproar and uncontrolled chaos with loud confused noise and disorder
examples: Pandemonium broke out when the concert was suddenly cancelled
The classroom descended into pandemonium after the teacher left

definitions: single sheet of glass in a window or door frame
examples: The storm shattered several window panes in the greenhouse
She pressed her face against the cold pane to see outside

definitions: decorative wood or other material covering walls in sheets or sections
examples: The dark oak paneling gave the room a formal atmosphere
They removed the old paneling to reveal the original brick wall

definitions: person who serves as a member of a discussion panel or committee
examples: Each panelist shared their expertise on climate change solutions
The television show featured three panelists debating current events

definitions: sudden sharp feeling of physical pain or emotional distress
examples: She felt a pang of guilt about forgetting the appointment
Hunger pangs reminded him he hadn't eaten since breakfast

definitions: narrow strip of territory projecting from a larger area like a pan handle
examples: Florida's panhandle extends westward along the Gulf of Mexico
They drove through the Texas panhandle on their way to Colorado

definitions: unbroken view of an entire surrounding area seen from one point
examples: The mountain summit offered a breathtaking panorama of the valley
The restaurant's panorama windows provided views of the entire city

definitions: garden flower with flat five-petaled blooms in various bright colors including purple yellow and white
examples: She planted pansies along the garden path for spring color
The purple and yellow pansies brightened the window box

definitions: all the gods of a particular culture or religion collectively
temple dedicated to all gods or notable building housing memorials
examples: Zeus ruled over the Greek pantheon from Mount Olympus
The Roman pantheon included many gods borrowed from Greek mythology
The Pantheon in Rome has stood for nearly two thousand years
Many national heroes are buried in the pantheon in Paris

definitions: large powerful wild cat typically with black fur found in tropical regions
examples: The black panther moved silently through the jungle undergrowth
Rangers spotted a Florida panther near the nature preserve

definitions: dramatic entertainment using gestures without words to express meaning or tell a story
examples: The street performer entertained crowds with clever pantomime routines
Children played charades using pantomime to act out movie titles

definitions: small room or closet for storing food dishes and cooking supplies
examples: She organized the pantry shelves with labeled containers for grains
The walk-in pantry held enough supplies for several months

definitions: informal affectionate word for father used especially by children
examples: The little girl ran to papa when he came home from work
Papa always told the best bedtime stories to his grandchildren

definitions: office and authority of the pope as head of the Roman Catholic Church including its administration
examples: The papacy has influenced European politics for over a thousand years
Several reforms were introduced during his papacy to modernize church practices

definitions: large oval tropical fruit with orange flesh and black seeds growing on trees
examples: She added fresh papaya chunks to the tropical fruit salad
The ripe papaya had sweet orange flesh perfect for breakfast

definitions: book with flexible paper cover instead of hard binding usually less expensive
examples: She packed several paperback novels for her beach vacation reading
The paperback edition costs much less than the hardcover version

definitions: thick stiff paper or cardboard material used for packaging and containers
examples: The cereal box was made from recycled paperboard material
They used paperboard dividers to organize the file drawer contents

definitions: routine written work or documentation required for administrative tasks and record keeping
examples: She spent hours completing paperwork for the mortgage application
The new job required extensive paperwork including background checks

definitions: ground spice made from dried red peppers ranging from sweet to hot
examples: She sprinkled paprika on the deviled eggs for color and flavor
Hungarian goulash requires generous amounts of sweet paprika

definitions: accepted standard or normal level of performance quality or condition
standard number of strokes set for each hole on a golf course
examples: His work performance has been below par for several months
The company's earnings were on par with analyst expectations
She finished the hole two strokes under par for a birdie
The challenging course had a par of seventy-two strokes

definitions: simple story told to illustrate a moral or spiritual lesson often found in religious texts
examples: Jesus taught using parables like the story of the good Samaritan
The parable of the tortoise and hare teaches about overconfidence

definitions: symmetrical U-shaped curve formed by points equidistant from a fixed point and line
examples: The basketball followed a perfect parabola arc toward the hoop
Students graphed the parabola using the quadratic equation

definitions: large fabric canopy device that slows descent through air used for safe landing
examples: The skydiver's parachute opened smoothly at three thousand feet
Emergency supplies were dropped by parachute to the stranded hikers

definitions: sport or activity of jumping from aircraft and descending with a parachute
examples: She took up parachuting as a way to overcome her fear of heights
Military training includes parachuting from various types of aircraft

definitions: person who jumps from aircraft using a parachute especially as sport or profession
examples: The experienced parachutist had completed over five hundred jumps
Military parachutists landed behind enemy lines during the operation

definitions: typical example or pattern of something serving as a model or framework for understanding
examples: The discovery created a new paradigm for understanding human evolution
The company's business paradigm shifted from products to services

definitions: place or state of perfect happiness and beauty often referring to heaven or an ideal location
examples: The tropical island seemed like paradise with pristine beaches and clear water
Many religions describe paradise as the eternal reward for righteous souls

definitions: statement or situation that seems contradictory but may express a truth or have valid reasoning
examples: The paradox of choice suggests too many options can decrease satisfaction
It's a paradox that you need experience to get a job that provides experience

definitions: white waxy solid substance derived from petroleum used in candles and waterproofing
examples: She melted paraffin wax to seal the homemade jam jars
The spa treatment included dipping hands in warm paraffin for soft skin

definitions: sport of flying with a parachute-like canopy while harnessed and launching from high ground
examples: Paragliding over the mountains provided spectacular views of the valley
She took paragliding lessons during her vacation in the Alps

definitions: person or thing regarded as a perfect example of a particular quality
examples: She was considered a paragon of virtue in the small community
The athlete became a paragon of dedication and perseverance

definitions: small slender parrot with long tail feathers often kept as a pet
examples: The blue parakeet chirped happily from its perch in the cage
Wild parakeets have established colonies in several urban parks

definitions: trained professional who assists lawyers with legal work but is not a qualified attorney
examples: The paralegal prepared all the documents for the court filing
She worked as a paralegal while attending law school at night

definitions: lines that never intersect remaining the same distance apart or things that are similar and comparable
examples: The railroad tracks run parallel to the highway for several miles
Historians drew parallels between the two revolutionary movements

definitions: use of similar grammatical structures or the state of being parallel in form meaning or development
examples: Good writing uses parallelism to create rhythm and clarity in sentences
The parallelism between the two historical events was remarkably striking

definitions: flat four-sided shape with opposite sides parallel and equal in length
examples: Students calculated the area of the parallelogram using base times height
A rectangle is a special type of parallelogram with right angles

definitions: person affected by paralysis unable to move part or all of their body
examples: The paralytic required daily assistance with basic activities
Medical advances have improved life quality for many paralytics

definitions: trained medical professional who provides emergency care and transports patients to hospitals
examples: The paramedic administered first aid at the accident scene
Paramedics arrived within minutes and stabilized the injured person

definitions: organized civilian force that operates like a military unit but is not part of regular armed forces
examples: The paramilitary group patrolled the border region for smugglers
Some security companies employ paramilitary personnel for high-risk assignments

definitions: mental condition characterized by delusions of persecution or excessive suspicion and mistrust of others
examples: His paranoia made him believe everyone was plotting against him
The political climate created an atmosphere of paranoia and distrust

definitions: person suffering from paranoia showing unreasonable suspicion or mistrust of others
examples: The paranoid neighbor installed multiple security cameras around his property
She became increasingly paranoid about her coworkers' intentions

definitions: low protective wall along the edge of a roof bridge or balcony
examples: Soldiers crouched behind the castle parapet during the siege
The bridge parapet prevented cars from going over the edge

definitions: miscellaneous articles equipment or accessories especially those needed for a particular activity
examples: The artist's studio was filled with painting paraphernalia and supplies
Police found drug paraphernalia during the routine traffic stop

definitions: expression of meaning of something using different words while retaining the same sense
examples: Students must paraphrase sources rather than copying text directly
Her paraphrase captured the essence of the complex scientific theory

definitions: paralysis of the lower half of the body including both legs typically from spinal injury
examples: The accident resulted in paraplegia requiring lifelong wheelchair use
Modern treatments have improved outcomes for patients with paraplegia

definitions: island country in the Caribbean Sea known for spice production especially nutmeg
examples: Grenada produces nearly forty percent of the world's nutmeg supply
Tourists flock to Grenada for its beautiful beaches and spice plantations
